meanings.definition: A person who outbids others in an auction.
meanings.sent1: The outbidder won the painting at the auction.
meanings.sent2: The outbidder raised the price of the antique vase.
meanings.sent3: The outbidder was like a skilled hunter, always getting the prize.
meanings.sent4: In the world of auctions, the outbidder was a fierce competitor.
meanings.sent5: The outbidder's strategy was to wait until the last moment to make a move.

meanings.definition: To outbid someone in an auction.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outbid the others for the rare stamp.
meanings.sent2: He outbid his rival for the vintage car.
meanings.sent3: The outbidder quickly became the center of attention at the auction.
meanings.sent4: In the game of auctions, he knew how to outbid his opponents.
meanings.sent5: Her determination to outbid everyone else was evident in her bidding style.
